db:abstract.db:para: The QTextDecoder class provides a state-based decoder.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A text decoder converts text from an encoded text format into Unicode using a specific codec.
The decoder converts text in this format into Unicode, remembering any state that is required between calls.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTextDecoder::QTextDecoder(const QTextCodec *codec)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a text decoder for the given codec.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.7] QTextDecoder::QTextDecoder(const QTextCodec *codec, QTextCodec::ConversionFlags flags)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a text decoder for the given codec and conversion flags.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.7.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextDecoder::toUnicode(const char *chars, int len)
db:section.db:para: Converts the first len bytes in chars to Unicode, returning the result.
If not all characters are used (e.g. if only part of a multi-byte encoding is at the end of the characters), the decoder remembers enough state to continue with the next call to this function.

db:section.db:title: QString QTextDecoder::toUnicode(const QByteArray &ba)
db:section.db:para: Converts the bytes in the byte array specified by ba to Unicode and returns the result.

db:section.db:title: void QTextDecoder::toUnicode(QString *target, const char *chars, int len)
db:section.db:para: The converted string is returned in target.
